German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

mit- +‎ bringen

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈmɪtʰbʀɪŋn̩/
  • Audio
    		(file)

Verb[edit]

mitbringen (strong, third-person singular simple present bringt mit, past tense brachte mit, past participle mitgebracht, past subjunctive brächte mit, auxiliary haben)

  1. (transitive) to bring along, to bring with
  2. (transitive) to take along, to take with
